items.title: ChatLoopBackOff - Episode 43 (KubeVela)
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>KubeVela, an incubating CNCF project, is a modern application delivery platform that simplifies the deployment and management of cloud-native applications. It uses the Open Application Model (OAM) to create an application centric approach via "deployment as code".

Join CNCF Ambassador, Andy Suderman as he explores KubeVelaâ€™s value for teams by highlighting its integration with CI processes, built-in observability, multi-tenancy and security support.</article>

items.title: ChatLoopBackOff - Episode 42 (K8gb)
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content: <article>K8gb is an open-source global load balancer specifically designed for Kubernetes, by enabling high availability, seamless failover without manual intervention. It provides global server load balancing (GSLB) capabilities by distributing traffic across multiple geographically dispersed Kubernetes clusters. The project was created to offer a cloud-native and Kubernetes-native solution, eliminating the need for proprietary or complex external load balancing solutions. Join CNCF Ambassador Gerardo Lopez Falcon as he explores how K8gb operates using DNS-based load balancing, leveraging CoreDNS within the clusters.</article>

items.title: Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) Initiative Meeting - 2025-01-14
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content: <article>Don't miss out! Join us at our next Flagship Conference: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe in London from April 1 - 4, 2025. Connect with our current graduated, incubating, and sandbox projects as the community gathers to further the education and advancement of cloud native computing. Learn more at https://kubecon.io</article>

items.title: ChatLoopBackOff - Episode 41 (Meshery)
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Meshery is an extensible engineering platform for the collaborative design and operation of cloud and cloud native infrastructure and applications. Meshery makes infrastructure and application management less about finger-pointing and more about collaborating.

Engineering teams all too often find themselves siloed, using disparate tooling, inconsistent workflow, and have a lack of collaboration and shared process. By facilitating shared workspaces, a catalog of cloud native patterns, and a multi-player experience, Meshery empowers teams to work together effectively, streamlining infrastructure design and operational management.

Join CNCF Ambassador, Ahmed Bebars as he explores how Meshery seamlessly integrates with every CNCF project and your Kubernetes clusters.</article>
